ReferenceDocuments.name: What was the name of the trea
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the name of the treatment for which drug accountability was assessed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form  Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the name of the study treatment dispensed (e.g., DRUG A, DRUG B, BOTTLE 1).

ReferenceDocuments.name: DASCAT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. If it is known at the time of data collection, the treatment name may be collected in DASCAT (with appropriate, but different than DACAT, grouping values). The value of DASCAT would apply to all measurements on that record when mapped to SDTM. If needed, the CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DASCAT may be used to collect a category for each DATEST. See SDTMIG Section 6.3 for examples on populating DACAT and DASCAT. DASCAT can only be used if there is an DACAT and it must be a subcategorization of DACAT.

DataElement.changeDescription: 2021-6-9 ak Released per governance approval. 11-26-19 tmt removed NCI CSI, associated with NRDS CSI and changed Registration Status. 11-25-19 tmt transferred ownership from NCI Standards to NRDS/BMaeske. Created as part of the CDISC mapping task_ghd_08.24.18
